remarks: Sylow's second theorem.  Any ` P ` -group ` H ` is a subgroup of a conjugated ` P ` -group ` K ` of order ` P ^ n || ( # `` X ) ` with ` n ` maximal.  This is usually stated under the assumption that ` K ` is a Sylow subgroup, but we use a slightly different definition, whose equivalence to this one requires this theorem.  This is part of Metamath 100 proof #72.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)
statement:

sylow2b.xf $e |- ( ph -> X e. Fin ) $.
sylow2b.h $e |- ( ph -> H e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ) $.
sylow2b.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ) $.
sylow2b.a $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
sylow2b.hp $e |- ( ph -> P pGrp ( G |`s H ) ) $.
sylow2b.kn $e |- ( ph -> ( # ` K ) = ( P ^ ( P pCnt ( # ` X ) ) ) ) $.
sylow2b.d $e |- .- = ( -g ` G ) $.
sylow2b $p |- ( ph -> E. g e. X H C_ ran ( x e. K |-> ( ( g .+ x ) .- g ) ) ) $.
